def analyze_tweet(tweet):
    # Remove the @mention to get the text of the tweet
    tweet = tweet[2:]

    # Check if the tweet is related to a complaint, question or feedback
    if "complaint" in tweet.lower() or "problem" in tweet.lower():
        return {"useful": True}
    elif "question" in tweet.lower() or "help" in tweet.lower():
        return {"useful": True}
    elif "feedback" in tweet.lower() or "suggestion" in tweet.lower():
        return {"useful": True}

    # Check if the tweet is spam, ad or unrelated
    if "spam" in tweet.lower() or "ad" in tweet.lower():
        return {"useful": False}
    elif "unrelated" in tweet.lower() or "offtopic" in tweet.lower():
        return {"useful": False}

    # If none of the above conditions are met, assume it's not useful
    return {"useful": False}
